critique: This document is an executive order from Franklin D. Roosevelt approving a Code of Fair Competition for the Restaurant Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. It reflects a strong interventionist approach to the economy, typical of the New Deal era. The document aims to regulate labor practices, including wages and working hours, indicating a liberal approach to economic regulation. There is no direct mention of immigration, civil liberties, or federalism. The focus is on setting standards for fair competition and labor conditions within the restaurant industry. The document does not directly address social inclusion or diversity. The order expands executive power by implementing and modifying the code of fair competition.
